individualName.gco:CharacterString: American Geographical Society Library – UWM Libraries

metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

abstract.gco:CharacterString: This point data layer represents waterfalls for Colorado in 1999. The dataset was originally published by the Colorado Geological Survey in 1999.[Waterfalls of Colorado extracted from the Geographic Names Information System dataset]

purpose.gco:CharacterString:
This layer is intended for reference and mapping purposes and may be used for basic applications such as viewing, querying, and map output production or to provide a basemap to support graphical overlays and analysis with other spatial data.
[To aid the Federal Government's purpose of promoting geographic feature name standardization. The names listed in the inventory can be published on Federal maps, charts, and in other documents.]

useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: Please see the UWM Libraries statement on Copyright and Digital Collections.

Although this data is being distributed by the American Geographical Society Library at the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee Libraries, no warranty expressed or implied is made by the University as to the accuracy of the data and related materials. The act of distribution shall not constitute any such warranty, and no responsibility is assumed by the University in the use of this data, or related materials.
[Although every effort has been made to produce a digitally usable dataset, no warranty is expressed or implied regarding the utility or accuracy of this data.]

supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: Augmented original metadata with AGSL specific elements. For official metadata contact the resource Point of Contact.

individualName.gco:CharacterString: American Geographical Society Library – UWM Libraries

evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: [Logical consistency remains unchanged from federal GNIS dataset. At that time Locative references (geographic coordinates, topographic map, and county) were cross-checked for logical consistency.]

measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: [Logical consistency remains unchanged from federal GNIS dataset. At that time Locative references (geographic coordinates, topographic map, and county) were cross-checked for logical consistency.\
[This dataset contains water fall information reported by the Geographic Information Names Information System, which are identified by a proper name.]

[Accuracy remains unchanged from federal GNIS data, which was tested by visually verifying a random sample of 10% of the entries in the system against the compilation source data (large-scale USGS topographic maps) to ensure an accuracy rate of at least 95%.]

[Accuracy remains unchanged from GNIS data, which was based upon the use of source graphics which are compiled to meet National Map Accuracy Standards. Comparision to the graphic source is used as control to assess digital positional accuracy.]
Attribute information remains the same as given by the author of the data.

description.gco:CharacterString: [Dataset copied from the Geographic Names Information System. Data subset for Colorado and specific feature type.]
Changed name of file from gnis_water_falls.shp to Colorado_Waterfalls_1999.shp.

individualName.gco:CharacterString: American Geographical Society Library – UWM Libraries
